metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8331 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Bootstrap before 3.4.1 and 4.3.x before 4.3.1, XSS is possible in thetooltip or popover data-template attribute.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8331` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-bootstrap4 - 4.3.1+dfsg2-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

fonts-glyphicons-halflings - 1.009~3.4.1+dfsg-1
libjs-bootstrap - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: twitter-bootstrap4 package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.1+dfsg2-1').
twitter-bootstrap3 package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1+dfsg-1').
twitter-bootstrap3 package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1+dfsg-1').
